intro: Bulbophyllum stolzii, commonly known as the Stolz’s ghost orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, elongated pseudobulbs and intricate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often on tree trunks or in rocky crevices. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive, waxy appearance. Due to its habitat specificity and rarity, it is considered a delicate and endangered species in its native range.
